intro: Codonopsis fioetens var. major, commonly known as the large-flowered codonopsis, is a herbaceous plant native to China. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pale blue. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and features opposite, lanceolate leaves with serrated edges. It thrives in well-drained soil and partial shade, making it a suitable candidate for woodland gardens. The flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
